title: 14 New York Builders and Contractors You Need to Know From the AD PRO Directory
description: Searching for New York builders and contractors to hire? Look no further than our AD-approved list
author: Elizabeth Stamp
excerpt: Searching for New York builders and contractors to hire? Look no further than our AD-approved list
text: Finding the right builder or contractor can make or break a project. Fortunately, the AD PRO Directory can help—as of tomorrow, when the platform launches its new builder and contractor category, users will be able to find not only the right talents to get the job done, but also those who will complete it with the attention to detail and craftsmanship it deserves. Whether they’re working with an outside architect or designer or handling everything in-house, these firms are adept at bringing their clients’ visions to fruition while keeping things on time and on budget. If you’re starting a renovation or building your dream home from the ground up, these AD-approved New York–area builders and contractors should be your first call. Here’s a sneak peek at our earliest builder members.Z BuildersZ Builder’s Atelier 96 is a custom-fit 8,600-square-feet residence in Amagansett, with 5,545 square feet of interior living space. This six-bedroom, five-and-a-half-bath home is thoughtfully designed to balance luxury with simplicity, offering a refined yet effortless living experience. Jonathan HökkloStudio Zung founder Tommy Zung and senior architectural professional Kupal Fontaine bring their combined talents and experience to Z Builders, a design-build firm based in Manhattan and Amagansett. The firm works seamlessly with Studio Zung to bring the architecture and interior studio’s designs to life through a frictionless, unified process. Z Builders places an emphasis on quality craftsmanship, teaming with skilled artisans throughout the process, and it’s committed to using long-lasting, sustainable materials that are ethically sourced.Scandic BuildersScandic Builders crafted a charming Shingle style country home in Harding, New Jersey. Courtesy of Scandic BuildersLocated an hour outside of New York City in Basking Ridge, New Jersey, Scandic Builders is a family-run company that brings together American and Scandinavian building traditions. Led by the Jepsen family, the firm works on a variety of projects from 10,000-square-foot new builds to sensitive renovations of historic homes. Scandic Builders takes an environmentally conscious approach to construction, encouraging clients to incorporate sustainable or recycled materials and renewable energy sources into their homes.Vernacular DesignFor this residential kitchen in Rhinebeck, New York, Vernacular Design created reclaimed wood elements, such as the barn applewood veneer for all the exposed wood panels, along with oiled white oak casework, and integrated lighting details. Steven PaneccasioHudson Valley native Jack Decker brings a deep knowledge of the region’s architectural and design history to his company, Vernacular Design. Decker and his team specialize in custom cabinetry, millwork, furniture, and woodworking, crafting traditional and modern pieces that complete and enhance the spaces they occupy. From building hidden bars and custom bunk beds to restoring existing spaces, Vernacular Designs does it all with exacting attention to detail and an emphasis on exquisite yet simple materials.Momentas, Inc.When renovating the Manhattan apartment of architect Amie Sachs and real estate developer Curtis Sachs, Momentas removed non-load-bearing walls and the firm’s in-house millworkers built and installed the kitchen, paneling, and storage, maximizing every inch of space. Alexandra RowleyA go-to for talents such as architect Amie Sachs and designer Monique Gibson, who worked with the firm on the renovation of Meg Ryan’s SoHo loft and on the designer’s own East Village town house, Momentas provides construction and post-renovation maintenance services for high-end residential projects in New York City. Founded by Nathan Stamm in 2012, the firm prides itself on its collaborative relationships with clients, architects, designers, and craftspeople, and its ability to execute large-scale, complex projects. Momentas’s skilled team allows the company to execute or oversee nearly every aspect of a project, from millwork to window treatments.OOR Design BuildIn the heart of a landmarked 1870s co-op, OOR Design Build has reimagined a historic space into a stunning, family-friendly sanctuary. The complete renovation merges open-concept living with luxurious details, featuring a show-stopping Brazilian quartzite that brings warmth and character to the sleek, glossy white cabinetry. naturalexpressionsnyOffering design-build, interior design, construction management, and developer services, OOR Design Build is a one-stop shop for projects in and around the New York area. Founded by Leah Almog Arazi in 2007, the firm has worked on projects of all sizes, from city apartments and Brooklyn brownstones to large condo buildings. OOR Design Build collaborates closely with homeowners, developers, and architects on renovations and new construction, ensuring that every detail of the finished product is just right.Prime RenovationsFor a gut renovation in Tribeca, Prime Renovations exposed and whitewashed the existing brick, and accented another wall with reclaimed wood to create a unique living space. Courtesy of Prime RenovationsFor Manhattan-based Prime Renovations, transparency and communication are at the heart of the client experience. Founded in 2004 by Jeff Streich, the luxury contracting firm works closely with architects and designers to bring even the smallest details to fruition while managing the construction process and finding solutions to any challenges that arise. From a glam apartment on Sutton Place to a contemporary Tribeca loft, Prime Renovations works on residential and commercial projects of all types and styles.Highline Construction GroupHighline Contruction Group collaborated with Workshop/APD on this modern kitchen, part of a gut renovation of a Central Park West duplex. Read McKendreeThere’s a reason many of Manhattan’s top architects and designers, such as Workshop/APD, Ingrao Inc, and Joseph Dirand have Highline Construction Group on speed dial. The boutique construction management and general contracting firm specializes in bespoke residential renovations, working on projects in some of the city’s most high-profile towers and historic landmark buildings. Adept at handling complex renovations, Highline Construction Group’s team of project managers, site supervisors, and talented artisans oversee every step of the project from demolition to finishing touches.S. Donadic Inc.This richly polished mahogany dressing room in a home by S. Donadic Inc. highlights the intricate joinery and geometry that defines this classic wardrobe. William AbranowiczNew York’s high-profile architects and designers, including Alexa Hampton, Bunny Williams, and Thomas Juul-Hansen, repeatedly call on S. Donadic Inc. to bring their designs to life. The firm was founded in 1973 as an architectural millwork company, and it quickly expanded to include high-end residential construction management and general contracting services, from penthouses to town houses to co-op apartments, S. Donadic has hundreds of completed projects in its portfolio, and that depth of experience allows the team to easily navigate the challenges of New York City construction.Koral Brothers Inc.Expertly constructed by Koral Brothers Inc., this contemporary residence and landscape employ native plantings, subtly undulating landforms, and material textures and colors to evoke a weathered driftwood aesthetic. Joshua McHughCustom home builder Koral Brothers Inc. was founded in 1920, and today the family-run business has become a trusted resource for firms such as Sawyer | Berson, McApline House, Steven Holl Architects, and Aero Studios. Known as “The Architect’s Builder,” the firm focuses on residences in the Hamptons but has completed projects as far afield as Aspen. Whether Koral Brothers is building a modern beach house or a classic shingle-clad residence, the firm’s team of architects, structural engineers, project managers, and craftspeople can handle every aspect of the project from concept to completion.Pollack + PartnersBuilt as a main house and carriage house in 1804, this backcountry home renovated by Pollack + Partners embraces a mix of old and new aesthetics. Photo by Kyle Norton / Architect: Roger Ferris + PartnersFounded by Christopher Pollack in 2001, Pollack + Partners works as private developers, master builders, and project managers, and has the ability to oversee all aspects of a home’s design and construction. Based in Greenwich, Connecticut, the firm works on projects throughout the region, including Manhattan town houses and Hamptons retreats, frequently collaborating with in-demand architects and designers. Pollack + Partners is also known for its historic renovations, which combine modern comforts and timeless details.SetzlerSetzler’s mahogany Barrel Stool is shown in a custom home office with a two-wall spanning desk. The space features a push-open drawer, a covered space for a printer, and a built-in file cabinet. The desk is outfitted with an adjustable drawing table. Jamie KueiBrooklyn-based Setzler creates custom furnishings that feel like art pieces. The firm’s work can be found in homes, galleries, offices, and stores, and each bespoke piece is the result of a collaboration between Setzler and its clients. The firm has worked with AD100 firms Charlap Hyman & Herrero and Studio Giancarlo Valle on projects, including elements for Porta, a home store in Brooklyn, and recently designed an organdy fabric “room” for Jacqueline Sullivan Gallery.Graphic BuildersIn a home renovated by Graphic Builders, a Dale Chihuly custom chandelier takes center stage in the living room overlooking Central Park. Adam Kane Macchia PhotographyFounded by husband-and-wife team Martin and Mary McElroy, Graphic Builders specializes in custom gut renovations across New York City. The general contractor has nearly 30 years of experience transforming apartments, co-ops, and town houses and takes on a select number of projects each year, ensuring that each client receives the attention their home deserves. Graphic Builders works with a skilled roster of subcontractors and artisans, and the firm’s project managers keep every project on schedule and on budget.SuperStrataWhen the biggest names in architecture, design, and fashion want to elevate their spaces with one-of-a-kind elements, they turn to SuperStrata, a New York-based artisan collective which includes talented craftspeople across the country. The collective includes artisans trained in a variety of techniques, including architectural and ornamental plaster, decorative painting, murals, églomisé, painted floors, and gilding. Founded by artisan Jonas Everets, SuperStrata has accentuated residential and commercial spaces from Antigua to Beverly Hills.Reis ContractingFounded in 1986, Reis Contracting is a family business now run by the second generation. The firm, which counts high-profile designers and architects such as Nicole Hollis Design, Steven Volpe Design, Robert Couturier, and Wesley Moon Inc. as clients, pushes to innovate and use the latest technology in its projects while still honoring the firm’s tradition of craftsmanship. With offices in New York City, Los Angeles, and Long Island, Reis Contracting works on projects regionally and nationally.APPLY NOWGrow your business with the AD PRO DirectoryArrowAre you looking for a design professional to hire for your next project? Wherever you are, visit the AD PRO Directory to browse our list of AD-approved designers and builders and find your match for a design consultation.
html:
Finding the right builder or contractor can make or break a project. Fortunately, the AD PRO Directory can help—as of tomorrow, when the platform launches its new builder and contractor category, users will be able to find not only the right talents to get the job done, but also those who will complete it with the attention to detail and craftsmanship it deserves. Whether they’re working with an outside architect or designer or handling everything in-house, these firms are adept at bringing their clients’ visions to fruition while keeping things on time and on budget. If you’re starting a renovation or building your dream home from the ground up, these AD-approved New York–area builders and contractors should be your first call. Here’s a sneak peek at our earliest builder members.

Z Builders

Studio Zung founder Tommy Zung and senior architectural professional Kupal Fontaine bring their combined talents and experience to Z Builders, a design-build firm based in Manhattan and Amagansett. The firm works seamlessly with Studio Zung to bring the architecture and interior studio’s designs to life through a frictionless, unified process. Z Builders places an emphasis on quality craftsmanship, teaming with skilled artisans throughout the process, and it’s committed to using long-lasting, sustainable materials that are ethically sourced.

Scandic Builders

Located an hour outside of New York City in Basking Ridge, New Jersey, Scandic Builders is a family-run company that brings together American and Scandinavian building traditions. Led by the Jepsen family, the firm works on a variety of projects from 10,000-square-foot new builds to sensitive renovations of historic homes. Scandic Builders takes an environmentally conscious approach to construction, encouraging clients to incorporate sustainable or recycled materials and renewable energy sources into their homes.

Vernacular Design

Hudson Valley native Jack Decker brings a deep knowledge of the region’s architectural and design history to his company, Vernacular Design. Decker and his team specialize in custom cabinetry, millwork, furniture, and woodworking, crafting traditional and modern pieces that complete and enhance the spaces they occupy. From building hidden bars and custom bunk beds to restoring existing spaces, Vernacular Designs does it all with exacting attention to detail and an emphasis on exquisite yet simple materials.

Momentas, Inc.

A go-to for talents such as architect Amie Sachs and designer Monique Gibson, who worked with the firm on the renovation of Meg Ryan’s SoHo loft and on the designer’s own East Village town house, Momentas provides construction and post-renovation maintenance services for high-end residential projects in New York City. Founded by Nathan Stamm in 2012, the firm prides itself on its collaborative relationships with clients, architects, designers, and craftspeople, and its ability to execute large-scale, complex projects. Momentas’s skilled team allows the company to execute or oversee nearly every aspect of a project, from millwork to window treatments.

OOR Design Build

Offering design-build, interior design, construction management, and developer services, OOR Design Build is a one-stop shop for projects in and around the New York area. Founded by Leah Almog Arazi in 2007, the firm has worked on projects of all sizes, from city apartments and Brooklyn brownstones to large condo buildings. OOR Design Build collaborates closely with homeowners, developers, and architects on renovations and new construction, ensuring that every detail of the finished product is just right.

Prime Renovations

For Manhattan-based Prime Renovations, transparency and communication are at the heart of the client experience. Founded in 2004 by Jeff Streich, the luxury contracting firm works closely with architects and designers to bring even the smallest details to fruition while managing the construction process and finding solutions to any challenges that arise. From a glam apartment on Sutton Place to a contemporary Tribeca loft, Prime Renovations works on residential and commercial projects of all types and styles.

Highline Construction Group

There’s a reason many of Manhattan’s top architects and designers, such as Workshop/APD, Ingrao Inc, and Joseph Dirand have Highline Construction Group on speed dial. The boutique construction management and general contracting firm specializes in bespoke residential renovations, working on projects in some of the city’s most high-profile towers and historic landmark buildings. Adept at handling complex renovations, Highline Construction Group’s team of project managers, site supervisors, and talented artisans oversee every step of the project from demolition to finishing touches.

S. Donadic Inc.

New York’s high-profile architects and designers, including Alexa Hampton, Bunny Williams, and Thomas Juul-Hansen, repeatedly call on S. Donadic Inc. to bring their designs to life. The firm was founded in 1973 as an architectural millwork company, and it quickly expanded to include high-end residential construction management and general contracting services, from penthouses to town houses to co-op apartments, S. Donadic has hundreds of completed projects in its portfolio, and that depth of experience allows the team to easily navigate the challenges of New York City construction.

Koral Brothers Inc.

Custom home builder Koral Brothers Inc. was founded in 1920, and today the family-run business has become a trusted resource for firms such as Sawyer | Berson, McApline House, Steven Holl Architects, and Aero Studios. Known as “The Architect’s Builder,” the firm focuses on residences in the Hamptons but has completed projects as far afield as Aspen. Whether Koral Brothers is building a modern beach house or a classic shingle-clad residence, the firm’s team of architects, structural engineers, project managers, and craftspeople can handle every aspect of the project from concept to completion.

Pollack + Partners

Founded by Christopher Pollack in 2001, Pollack + Partners works as private developers, master builders, and project managers, and has the ability to oversee all aspects of a home’s design and construction. Based in Greenwich, Connecticut, the firm works on projects throughout the region, including Manhattan town houses and Hamptons retreats, frequently collaborating with in-demand architects and designers. Pollack + Partners is also known for its historic renovations, which combine modern comforts and timeless details.

Setzler

Brooklyn-based Setzler creates custom furnishings that feel like art pieces. The firm’s work can be found in homes, galleries, offices, and stores, and each bespoke piece is the result of a collaboration between Setzler and its clients. The firm has worked with AD100 firms Charlap Hyman & Herrero and Studio Giancarlo Valle on projects, including elements for Porta, a home store in Brooklyn, and recently designed an organdy fabric “room” for Jacqueline Sullivan Gallery.

Graphic Builders

Founded by husband-and-wife team Martin and Mary McElroy, Graphic Builders specializes in custom gut renovations across New York City. The general contractor has nearly 30 years of experience transforming apartments, co-ops, and town houses and takes on a select number of projects each year, ensuring that each client receives the attention their home deserves. Graphic Builders works with a skilled roster of subcontractors and artisans, and the firm’s project managers keep every project on schedule and on budget.

SuperStrata

When the biggest names in architecture, design, and fashion want to elevate their spaces with one-of-a-kind elements, they turn to SuperStrata, a New York-based artisan collective which includes talented craftspeople across the country. The collective includes artisans trained in a variety of techniques, including architectural and ornamental plaster, decorative painting, murals, églomisé, painted floors, and gilding. Founded by artisan Jonas Everets, SuperStrata has accentuated residential and commercial spaces from Antigua to Beverly Hills.

Reis Contracting

Founded in 1986, Reis Contracting is a family business now run by the second generation. The firm, which counts high-profile designers and architects such as Nicole Hollis Design, Steven Volpe Design, Robert Couturier, and Wesley Moon Inc. as clients, pushes to innovate and use the latest technology in its projects while still honoring the firm’s tradition of craftsmanship. With offices in New York City, Los Angeles, and Long Island, Reis Contracting works on projects regionally and nationally.

APPLY NOW

Grow your business with the AD PRO Directory

Are you looking for a design professional to hire for your next project? Wherever you are, visit the AD PRO Directory to browse our list of AD-approved designers and builders and find your match for a design consultation.
